sen.j: 斐陀国造（ひだのくにのみやつこ・ひだこくぞう）は飛騨国を支配した国造。
sen.e: Hidanokuninomiyatsuko 斐陀国造 (also known as Hidakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled Hida Province.
Hida no kuninomiyatsuko 斐陀国造 (also known as Hidakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Hida Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Hida no kuninomiyatsuko 斐陀国造 (also known as Hidakokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Hida Province.

sen.j: 斐太国造・飛騨国造とも。
sen.e: It is also written as 斐太国造, 飛騨国造.
It is also written as 斐太国造, 飛騨国造.
It is also written as 斐太国造, 飛騨国造.

sen.j: 『国造本紀』によると成務天皇朝に奥津餘曾の子の大八埼命が斐陀国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Ooyakinomikoto, a son of Okutsuyoso, was appointed Hidanokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
According to "Kokuzo hongi", Ooyakinomikoto, a son of Okutsuyoso, was appointed Hidanokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: 斐陀氏。

sen.j: 姓は国造。
sen.e: Kabane was Kuninomiyatsuko.
Kabane was Kuninomiyatsuko.

sen.j: 物部氏・尾張氏などと同系。
sen.e: The clan was descended from the same line as the Mononobe clan and the Owari clan.
The clan was descended from the same line as the Mononobe clan and the Owari clan.
The clan was descended from the same line as the Mononobe clan and the Owari clan.

sen.j: 飛騨国。

sen.j: 現在の岐阜県高山市・飛騨市・下呂市・白川村。

sen.j: 祭神の水無神は天火明命の別名とする説がある。
sen.e: There is an opinion that the enshrined deity 'Minashijin' is a pseudonym of Amenohoakarinomikoto.
There is an opinion that the enshrined deity 'Minashijin' is a pseudonym of Amenohoakari no mikoto.

sen.j: 飛騨国一宮。
sen.e: Ichinomiya, Hida Province.

sen.j: 飛騨高市麻呂 ...... 奈良時代の豪族。
sen.e: Hida no Takechimaro: A regional powerful clan during the Nara period.
